title.narrative: SCALE UP NUTRITION

description.narrative: By 2018, NAFIN able to coordinate and monitor the implementation of multi-sectoral Scaling-Up Nutrition Country Plan., which contributes to Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2018, stunting prevalence among children under 5 reduced nationally from current 29% to less than 20%.

participating-org.narrative: HARDAP REGIONAL HEALTH DIRECTORATE ST MARY S HOSPITAL
MINISTRY OF HOME AFFAIRS AND IMMIGR
THE NAMIBIA AIDS TRUST PREVENTION TRUST MOHSS NATIONAL LEVEL

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Capacity building for nutrition preparedness and response
Data, research, evaluation, evidence generation, synthesis, and use for prevention of stunting and other forms of malnutrition
Diet diversity in early childhood (children under 5), includes complementary feeding and MNPs
HSS - Health systems procurement and supplies management
Immunization supply chain, including cold chain
Other activities for equitable access to quality education e.g. school feeding, school grants
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Strengthening C4D in Government systems including preparedness for humanitarian action
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2018, NAFIN able to coordinate and monitor the implementation of multi-sectoral Scaling-Up Nutrition Country Plan.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to support NAFIN to coordinate and monitor the implementation of SUNCIP through quarterly meetings, while it also supported the re-establishment of the Food and Nutrition Security Council as an over-arching coordination body for nutrition at national and sub-national levels to replace NAFIN. | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/12/2018
